Reason: The configuration option 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb' is performance-sensitive. The triggering frequency of the fsync operation directly depends on the position of the cache and how frequently it exceeds the threshold defined by the interval in kilobytes. This can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, as more frequent fsync operations can impact system performance due to the overhead of disk synchronization. Therefore, the configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive, making it performance-sensitive.
